Jeneé OsterheldtDave Chappelle, Kamala Harris, and finding the joy in this moment The power of representation is real. Harris understands the responsibility. It’s in the words she chooses, her marching band dances, the names she amplifies, and the hard pauses she takes when she notes Black women.

The world needs Covid-19 vaccines. It may also be overestimating their powerThe world might in the not-too-distant future get vaccines against Covid-19. But those vaccines won’t necessarily prevent all or even most infections.

In a medical first, doctors treat Parkinson’s with a novel brain cell transplantIf successful, the surgery could change Parkinson’s disease from an inexorable, cruel, and sometimes fatal decline to — for at least some patients — a condition that can be successfully treated.
